qas.question: Where did the name Burma originate from ?

answers.text: names are derived from the name of the majority Burmese Bamar ethnic group

qas.question: What is the considered to be the name in slang terms for the people of Myanmar?

answers.text: Burma is derived from "Bamar", the colloquial form of the group's name

qas.question: How is the slang term for the people of Burma articulated correctly ?

answers.text: Depending on the register used, the pronunciation would be Bama (pronounced: [bəmà])

qas.question: When did the term for the people of Burma become a common place word in English?

answers.text: The name Burma has been in use in English since the 18th century.

context: In English, the country is popularly known as either "Burma" or "Myanmar" i/ˈmjɑːnˌmɑːr/. Both these <a0_0>names are derived from the name of the majority Burmese Bamar ethnic group<a0_0/>. Myanmar is considered to be the literary form of the name of the group, while <a1_0>Burma is derived from "Bamar", the colloquial form of the group's name<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Depending on the register used, the pronunciation would be Bama (pronounced: [bəmà])<a2_0/> or Myamah (pronounced: [mjəmà]). <a3_0>The name Burma has been in use in English since the 18th century.
